review: Tadalafil at 5mg a day complexity cured my chronic BPH.
Cialis (tadalafil):Works well during most of the day around 6pm BPH systems start to show up again.

I'm 54 and have experienced increasing ED problems over the past 2 years. In November I was diagnosed with early stage prostate cancer and also have BPH which is the cause of my ED. I'm not having any treatment beyond active surveillance and luckily have only mild symptoms (increase in frequency but that's it. No night time disturbance, etc). Annual health screening detected the cancer / BPH. Started taking daily 5mg Tadalafil in November and the results are superb. No side effects, except when combined with alcohol I sometimes get a stuffy nose. Erections are very strong and sex is very pleasurable again. (Being circumcised it does seem to flare out the glans a bit more.) I've also seen a reduction in frequency of urination. Really pleased with the drug which working well for me.

Cialis (tadalafil):I'm 62 and was prescribed 5 mg Cialis by my urologist for BPH and mild ED.  It worked very well for both the first day, but then I started to develop severe back pain so that I could hardly stand up.  I discontinued for 2 days taking Aleve, but then cut the pill down (use a sharp knife) to 2.5mg each morning and that works just fine.  So far, I need to urinate maybe once in the night, don't have the crazy urgency in the day, and enjoy erections and orgasms whenever I want to.  Ejaculation is super strong and productive.  Previously I had tried Flomax, but all that did was create more ED.  Extremely happy with Cialis at 2.5mg each morning.  Taking L-Arginine every evening doesn't hurt either.

My doctor recommended Tadalafil at 2.5 mg day for BPH. I was previously tried other meds without success. Prior to Tadafil, I was getting up 3-4 times a night to pee and if I had an urge while standing, I could not avoid leaking urine. After I took Tadafil, my night frequency was reduced to once, even no need to get up to urinate. I have started to sleep through the night which has provided me more energy during the. day. My erections became much stronger and that is a problem, since my wife has become asexual since menopause.
Cialis (tadalafil):I'll give it an 8 out of 10

My urologist prescribed  it for chronic prostatitis not bacterial prostatitis. I take 2,5 mg every other day. It is effective symptoms declined.  Furthermore it has  increased incredibly my erections. I am 58 years old.

My BPH symptoms were getting worse over the last 10 years and when I started to pee 5 times/night it was time to do something. I've been on 2.5 mg tadalafil for 2 months and am down to 1 time/night and occasionally even sleep through the night.

I am 55 years old and I have BPH 5 years. In the beginning I was taking tamsulosin but after few years I started to have abnormal ejaculation. I read effects of tamsulosin and I was thinking it is not other way. I was talking with my doctor and I was complaining and he prescribed me tadalafil and now I am happy.

Cialis (tadalafil):After several years trying a lot of different drugs for my enlarged prostate I have now the best treatment protocol: Tadalafil 5mg + Doxazosin 1mg ((half of a pill) at bed time. And they also improved a lot my sexual life. Try it!

Cialis (tadalafil):I was taking Flowmax and did not like the side effects. I started taking Cialis 5mg/day and after a month Cialis 5mg started to lose its effectiveness, Since last 2 years I've been taking Cialis 10mg/day and it works wonders, obviously, with favorable side effects! I am urinating a lot easier and it's improving slowly. I'm very satisfied with generic Cialis that I buy online from Egypt at 10% of the prices here in California. I buy 200 pills at a time at 23 cents a pill for 20mg that I split in half to take. It costs more for the FedEx than the generic Cialis. I calculated the total cost per pill including the FedEx, it comes to .43/pill that I cut in half to take. So it's costing 23 cents pr pill a day.

Cialis (tadalafil):Started taking flomax to treat enlarged prostate issues.  The side affects of flomax were stuffy nose and extreme fatigue which I couldn't tolerate.  Found Cialis  for BPH via Google searches and it's been a game changer for me.   Pee is easy now, flow decent and I no longer get the dull ache in my ball sack.  I never had erectile problems but whilst using Cialis I notice my erections are very hard.

Cialis (tadalafil):I wrote earlier that adding the .5 mg  Cialis combined with the 40mg Flomax gave me great results. BUT, the side effects (which a number of people have reported here ) were a big problem. Bad back aches and head aches after about 3 days of use. But great results with urinary problems of BPH. So I had to quit the Cialis for a few days to get it out of my system. Then started one half of a pill, every other day thinking that I will increase as need. Well never needed to increase.  Another words a quarter dose. And great results! Only get up once a night to pee!  First time for that in decades.  Also although didn’t have a lot of problems with erections for my age, 75, Yes it did improve that too. With just a quarter dose. And NO side effects. Have been on this regimen now for about 3 months.  All good!    PS. Initially my insurance wouldn’t cover Tadalafil but my Dr, called and explained that it was for BPH and now they cover it.

Cialis (tadalafil):Take Flomax for bph.  So so results with flomax. Added .5 TDalifil with good results in 1 day. By 3rd day had to stop due to bad back pain and headache. Have stopped now for a day 35 hrs since last dose and pain gone.  I will now try one dose every other day.  Will come back to site will results. Great to have all this info.  Thanks.

Cialis (tadalafil):After taking the drug Cialis I had medium success but over the next 12 hours developed several back pain such that I could barely walk. This continued for several days. I took it again a couple of weeks later ... and the same thing!  Have tried again over a period of several years.

I am taking  tadalafil  efill-5 mg, doctor prescribed it for my enlarged prostate, it works but  it has many side effects, I feel noise in my ears, decreased eye sight, laziness etc, I advise to don't take it, but one positive thing it works for sex performance,

Cialis (tadalafil):I’m a retired pharmacist. Please do not store any medication in the FREEZER thinking it may extend the shelf life. The moisture in a freezer may cause the drug to degrade (think of those bags of veggies you store). Unless otherwise advised, store at room temperature out of strong light.
Cialis (tadalafil):Works excellent for erection Has increase length Highly recommended

Cialis (tadalafil):I take the 5mg generic which cost $33.79 for 90 pills with goodrx coupon along with flomax. I now pee like like a champ and empty my bladder completely. No more waking up 5 times a night. The constant urge to pee has disappeared. Most all my prostatitis symptoms have gone away. Took about a week to feel the full benefits. No side effects that I've noticed except being able to keep my 24 year younger wife happy "anytime". I was truly suffering there for a while.
Cialis (tadalafil):5 mg daily. Wood is back.
Cialis (tadalafil):Compared to Flomax (Tamsulosin), Tadafadil is a game changer. Doesn’t stop  you're erection  or stop you're libido.

Have been taking Tadalafil 5mg for approximately a year for BPH and has helped greatly.  The only problem I have found is that different drug manufacturers affect me differently.  Some work for me without side effects and others give me headaches and ringing in my ears.  I tell my pharmacy and they think that I am just old and don't know what I'm talking about, just blow me off!  There is a difference for sure!
Cialis (tadalafil):Cialis has helped me immensely with my prostate issues. Highly recommend it. Expensive though. I get my meds from Canada, cheaper.
Got my first 90-day supply of 5mg Tadalafil( 90 pills) with discount coupon. My Urologist prescribed this for my BPH and minor ED.

So after only 3 days of 5mg dose I had to stop taking the Tadalafil.  I experienced side effects across the board.  Back pain, leg pain, congestion and ringing in the ears. Pain and complications were bad enough that I decided I will resume taking Viagra for my ED.  The blue pill is not as effective for me but I experience little side effects. I am  disappointed because WOW, the drug really helped me with my low ED problems.  Strong long lasting erection!  Hopefully you won't experience the problems I did taking Cialis.   Good luck!
this drug has changed my life. Works great. Solved my issue with urination problems. (and extra bonus helped with ED)

Cialis (tadalafil):I've used Cialis for a couple years since my TURP surgery which left me with not the best results in bed. Well it gets a 10 in that dept, but I do get the backaches. Stretches and yoga take care of that part. I'm 65 years old and bike ride and use the 5mg.

Diagnosed with BPH few years ago, I'm 54, and have tried several medicines (mainly Alpha Blockers), it does work but with a lot of side effects, my urologist suggested Tadalafil, and it is working very well by reducing symptoms of frequent urination urge during night, better flow of urine, and iron erection. Double Jackpot.

Cialis (tadalafil):Age 80. Tried Cialis 20mg prn for ED with excellent results. Now on 5mg qd with some improvement in urine flow after 1 month. Also good for ED. Also good for libido since it doesn't take much to get going and improved confidence that I can get the job done.

Cialis (tadalafil):I was scheduled for TURP invasive surgery for my BPH over 3 years ago. After talking to an East Indian friend of mine who also has the BPH (he's 72). He also opted for Cialis 10mg/daily. I started with 20mg daily but had erections all night long so I cut it to 10mg. I am 73 very athletic and workout with guys 25-35 years old without any feel of being behind them. I watch my weight which I maintain 140 lbs for 5ft.8 height. Instead of weight lifting etc.I do mostly stretching yoga exercises that keep my body toned and not to build the muscles. I look no more than 50 and still do the things (sex etc) like I am 25! Cialis 10mg/daily that I buy  at fraction of the cost. It has made me urinate normally and don't have a single side effect as I work out lightly at the Gym 3-4 times a week. Sauna, Jaccuzzi and steam really helps the body after workout.

Cialis (tadalafil):I’m in my 20s on this for BPH symptoms. Works very well, reduced trips to the bathroom in the morning from 3-4 times to just one trip. I’ve been on this medication for 2 months now. In my opinion it’s far superior to flomax for this issue. The added side effect of being able to go round after round in the bedroom is cool as well.

Cialis (tadalafil):I am 55 and have had BPH for the last 6 years. Was living in France at the time when diagnosed and their approach was to go for surgery. Once I'd read up on that I was like 'no way!' I was 50 not 75.So got prescribed Siladosin which worked well but didn't like the side effects of retro-ejaculation.So after researching on the internet I have been self-medicating 5mg Tadalafil (generic) for the last 4 years. It has made a difference, and I now can go 6/7 hours at night without needing to pee.I was taking it at around 10pm each evening. However, over the last six months I have noticed that it was becoming more difficult to pee during the daytime, so 5 days ago I started taking 1 x 5mg at 10pm in the evening, and 1 x 5 mg at 7am in the morning.  This has made a huge difference and I am now a lot more comfortable during the day and my flow has improved.
No side effects and is effective for BPH.

Cialis (tadalafil):I was prescribed Cialis for BPH 5 mg daily and having been 60 years old I welcomed the "side effect" of having  monster erections.All that did come with a price though, as about 3 days in to taking the 5 mg dose daily I started experiencing excruciating pain in my lower back and buttock.I did an extensive research in to this matter. I am NOT an MD. I am sharing what I found and what worked for me to rid of my pain and it has not returned since.This is based partially on a study I found and you should check with your doctor before you do this.Full disclaimer... I am sharing this NOT as a recommendation but as what I did and it is strictly for "entertainment purposes only"1. Discontinue Cialis for 5 days to clear it from your systemDo this for 3 days ONLY:2. Take Aleve 220 mg and Tylenol 325 mg  2 hour prior taking the 5 mg Cialis for 3 days ONLY3. Discontinue taking the Aleve 220 mg and Tylenol 325 mg after the day 34. Day 4 forward continue with the Cialis

Cialis (tadalafil):I can urinate easily with noticably better flow when I take Cialis 20 mg for ED. I also take flomax. I tried 5 mg Cialis daily for 3 weeks but side effects became too much and I had to stop. The aches and pains were not worth the benefit. If I was an old guy with a young bimbo I would take 5 mg daily to satisfy her. 5mg daily after a week let me have erections on demand.I still use 20 mg occaisionally for ED and it works great and lasts for 2 days. I prefer Levitra 20 mg for ED because the side effects don't last as long.

Cialis (tadalafil):I fax my prescription to a a Canadian pharmacy and receive a 90 day supply. It is a generic and cost $30 per month. It works tremendously well as I found out when I ran out for a month. Now after a few days back on  it I’m doing great again. I’m taking it for BPH but in helps me to have a stronger erection that lasts to climax. No side effects that I notice. I’m in my early sixties. I tried Flonase but it  made things worse for me

Cialis (tadalafil):I was taking the daily 5 mg dose, initially to see if it helped with my BPH symptoms and ED.  We found it did virtually nothing to improve my BPH symptoms, but also that it was the only dose my insurance would cover and only if it was prescribed for BPH and NOT for ED! (Go figure!)  I continued for about 4 years on 5 mg daily. During that same timeframe, I started experiencing brutal lower back pain during the night, causing sleep loss, and getting out of bed and standing in the morning became almost excruciating. At 68 y/o, I thought it was just age catching up with me.  Well, when I recently ran out, I decided to take a break, partly for financial reasons and partly because I wasn't experiencing enough benefits in the ED to justify the pricey copays. MUCH TO MY SURPRISE and delight, my severe back pain disappeared completely in only a few days!  What a hard learned lesson! (no pun intended!)

I'm, 60 and noticed BPH symptoms. A consultant confirmed this and tried me on Tamulosin (cheap!!). My body couldn't get on with Tamulosin (dizzy, reduced semen volume, retro-ejaculation). Tried Tadalafil (5mg daily). After three days, had indigestion/heartburn and lower back/upper leg ache. Stopped taking on the 4th day and by 5th day, I was ok again. Decided to take Tadalafil for two days then stop for third day, etc. did this for a week. This worked well - little heartburn, no back pain. I risked taking the drug daily again and was ok! Now been taking for 3weeks - very little indigestion, no back pain. I don't have urgency to pee and often don't need to get up at night. Not sure how long it takes for the drug to have optimum effect but ok after 3 weeks!! Still have reduced semen volume (from the Tamulosin) and numerous nocturnal erections! - just like being a lad again!! I pay 8.80GBP (standard National Health charge) per month for a month's supply.

Cialis (tadalafil):Works great on BPH ,doctor switches every 6 months from flomax and 6 months  on Cialis .That way body don't get adjusted  to one are the other. Side effects can be bothersome but worth it, cutback dosage to half every other day. Able sleep all night without going to bathroom often. Works great.

Cialis (tadalafil):For BPH sufferers in the UK, I offer my experience. Researching treatments for BPH, I discovered that the NHS has approve the prescription of cialis (or generic tadalafil) to address the symptoms of BPH.I persuaded my GP to prescribe it for me, and it works a treat, minimising the effects of my prostate enlargement (urgency, in my case).There is one side effect that should be noted. It promotes really good erections. To my mind, this is definitely a side effect to embrace!I note that in comparative trials, Tadalafil performed better than Tamsulosin.

Cialis (tadalafil):Waited for tadalafil to become generic as long as I could. Price for cialis way too much. Found online and bought. I had a little back ache for the first day or two then no side effects. I haven't been back to Dr to see if BPH has improved, but way awesome erection and climax improvement. If loving tadalafil is wrong I'll never be right. I take 5mg per day by splitting a 20mg. I know this is not recommended but it is the most economical way and not supposed to split - it works great so I'm OK with it. Supposed to be generic in USA in 2018.

Cialis (tadalafil):I buy cialis online for a tiny fraction of what you pay in Australia. I buy 20mg tablets for 20 cents each then quarter them. They work good for BPH and ED. The pharmacy industry is rolling us over a barrel.

Cialis (tadalafil):I had a severely bad experience with BHP for 6 months , tried all kind of medications recommended by the doctors , Urinating was a painful experience and even had blood drops because I was severely straining myself to urinate . After  reading the reviews of others I tried Cialis 5 mg daily and within 4 days there was ease in my symptoms and was able to urinate easily and relief from pain . Even the night time frequency of urinating stopped and was able to sleep better the whole night . This Cialis is a God sent solution . Excellent results .

Cialis (tadalafil):I'm a 70 year-old guy who has had BPH for over 10 years.  Was taking Avodart, which worked OK, but had the sexual side effect of reducing the amount of semen I produced, which greatly impeded my sexual performance.  Switched to 5 mg daily of Cialis 5 months ago.  I was pleased to find that semen production returned to normal in about 2 months, which was the main reason for switching drugs.  But much to my surprise I found that it reduced BPH symptoms by about 90%.  It's turned out to be a miracle drug for me--no side affects that I'm aware of.  Enhanced erections is an extra benefit.

Cialis (tadalafil):I've tried Viagra and found it worked pretty well, I had some side effects namely heart burn and headaches so thought I'd try Cialis to see if I suffered from the same effects. I started off by taking 10mg of Cialis and after an hour I had a slight stirring in the loins but that was about it, so took the remainder of the dosage (10mg) and it helped slightly but was still less that I would normally get without any medication, very disappointed and to top it all I've had heart burn most of the following day. I bought a pack of 8 costing a reasonable amount to add to the situation.  Guess it works for some and not others.

Cialis (tadalafil):Great site, read all the comments, I have only 1 kidney and been suffering form BPH for the last 3 plus years due to 1 Kidney removal. Have tried flow max - horrible side effects and loss of anysexual appeal. Having 1 kidney Hopefully my urologist can prescribe Cialis, Again great comments.

Cialis (tadalafil):When I was young I used to walk into a restroom and an old guy would be trying to pee.  When I left he was still trying to pee.  Well I ended up becoming that old guy.  I’m 50 and I have been diagnosed with BPH.  For the past 10 years I have had issues with my prostate.  I have been in and out of the doctors and urologist offices.  Also for the past few years I have had a tough time getting and maintaining an erection.  I have been taking 5mg of Cialis a day for the past 60 days.  Two words describe my experience wow / amazing.  I can now pee without any problem.  I'm ready anytime morning, noon, or night my wife and I want to have sex.    Before I would have to concentrate to get an erection and maybe or maybe not whether I could

Cialis (tadalafil):I have been taking 10mg Cialis, (Tadalafil) with great success.Used to have huge problems years ago, to the point that I was considering surgery.Many medications have terrible side effects like lowering your sexdrive, some even creating irreversible damage. I first found out years ago via the Internet, long before it got approved by the FDA, mentioned it to my Urologist, who was a professor at a university who approved it right away.Medicare is not covering it and the pharmacy was trying to charge $286 for a month supply. This left me the only option to find an  pharmacy on the Internet where I get a year supply at a time keeping it in the freezer to preserve its potency. Great results for my prostate and my sex life.

Cialis (tadalafil):I started taking 5 mg Cialis daily because of bothersome BPH during the day. (I did not have problems during the night.)  After only a couple of weeks, I was better, and in less than 2 months, BPH was not a problem.  I do have a somewhat stuffy nose occasionally, but this is minor. I consider myself fortunate to have seen BPH advertisements on television because the ads prompted me to ask my doctor about Cialis.

Cialis (tadalafil):I had Cyber Knife in 2015 & mild BPH before and after.Went over a year taking nothing  but Flo Max never worked for me, but my BPH got bad & started taking 5 mg cialis which  helped.First Urine Culture came back with blood & a UTI. Next 3 were clear Went on Cialis an & Cypro. Then Cialis & Ceturoxime for 7 days and STILL no answers I felt worse then before. I did made the MISTAKE of taking 2 Cialis for 3 days at the end of my  Ceturoxime because I felt so horrible DON"T DO THIS Dr said it was a toxic dose.Now  Ive been waiting for OVER a week on his orders of "Take Nothing & Go to ER if it gets worse" I cant take  anymore ! Going back to my Cialis to see if it can help again. It never did help with libido issues now or before. I have got rid of my Doc

It works (5mg) VERY, VERY well for BPH! BUT I'm paying $270 every month because there's no generic, so I've had to skip doses or refills because I cannot afford to pay 270 bucks a month on top of all my other medicine!When I do skip a month ALL of my symtoms of BPH return with a vengeance. Too bad Medicare won't pay part of it, nor will my Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska!My brother has BPH & he pays $70 thriGotta figure it out why mines not covered

Cialis (tadalafil):I'm a 50 year old with enlarged prostate that caused frequent NEED to urinate and a feeling of never quite emptying my bladder. ED wasn't much of a problem and if there were any issues it was most likely psychological. Within the first few days there was a noticeable difference in frequency and a feeling of emptying my bladder. No bad side effects. Just the flushing and "hot" episodes. I am on a few meds and I know there will be side effects for everything. I just see what is acceptable and work with it. Since my insurance will authorize this medication's use and the side-effects for me are pretty insignificant, I will continue to use it for it's benefits! Great med for my issues!

Cialis (tadalafil):I have been prescribed and have been taking cialis 5 mg to help my BPH symptoms and libido for over a year.  Cialis has not helped either of these problems what so ever.  A total disappointed.

Cialis (tadalafil):75 next year and despite gym work, young attitude, good looks and bod (for 74) prostate and ED have been real problems for some time. Tried 5 mgs daily for almost 1 month, and prostate benefits not too impressive. Depending on mood (psychological issue?)  10 to 20 mgs good for ED if not a bit mechanical. May trial again for a while though price here in Oz  round $150 for 4 weeks @ 5mgs a day is no plus!
Cialis (tadalafil):34 year old suffering from swollen prostate medicine worked good but had to stop taking it do to back pain that spread to my legs.

Cialis (tadalafil):I got some samples from my MD, and after 4 days I'm feeling much better. First time in about a year I've been able to empty my bladder. First time in years I've slept through the night. There seem to be a couple of side effects; slight headache, back stiffness. Nothing as bad as lying in bed, awake, in pain, or being afraid to sit in a theatre for 2 hours. It's going to be expensive, but I'll save money on Flomax and endless bottles of Saw Palmetto.

Cialis (tadalafil):Doctor prescribed Tamsulosin (Flowmax) for treatment of BPH. After taking for 30+ days, no improvement and ED side effects were terrible. Stopped Tamsulosin and started Cialis 5mg daily, now for about 45 days. BPH conditions have improved and ED side effects have gone completely away. Now trying to get my Medicare Rx insurance company to approve Cialis 5mg for my BPH drug treatment.

Cialis (tadalafil):I have been taking Cialis Daily (5mg) for about two years.  When first diagnosed by my Urologist, he prescribed Cialis. at the time it was just approved by FDA to treat BPH. My insurance ,TRICARE, would not authorize  until I had tested other drugs designed to treat the condition.  The two drugs tested caused very noticeable and uncomfortable side affects. Flomax and Avodart caused conditions such as severe urinary burning , headaches, and digestive discomfort.  Both were used for two weeks each.  Finally, I was approved for Cialis.  Almost immediately, I would say I les than a week, my BPH symptoms subsided significantly.  Urination need decreased and became easier. I suffer from Rosacea and this accentuated the blushing quite bit.

Cialis (tadalafil):Cialis 5mg daily has reduced frequent and spotty urination with no side effects.  However it has done nothing for ED.I have not had a prostrate exam since taking Cialis but assume it is reduced in size.

Cialis (tadalafil):I have been using Cialis 5 mg for over 2 years and it has worked very good for meno side effects at all that I have notice I have BPH and minor ED this pill works very well for both I am very happy with  it and will not try the Generic since they seem to lose something in the translation

Cialis (tadalafil):I was experiencing frequent urination, especially at night.  During the night, I would be up every hour to hour and a half to urinate and flow was weak.  I also had to urinate frequently during the day, although not as bad as at night.  I was also experiencing increasing urgency, when I had to go, I had to go!            My MD recommended Cialis 5mg daily to treat my BPH.  I began to notice results in approximately two weeks.  Now, I am up once or twice a night and my erections feel like they did when I was in my twenties!  (in my sixties now).  Only side effects have been flushing of my face and neck, not severe and only lasts a short time and my eyes are bloodshot sometimes.   Again, not severe.            Very happy with the results!

Cialis (tadalafil):I used Cialis 5mg per day for benign prostate enlargement from November 2013 until November 2015. Although it was apparently effective for limiting prostate problems, since I stopped it in November 2015 I am 99% sure that, as a person with zero history of epilepsy, it caused me to suffer from Transient Epileptic Amnesia [TEA] with the TEA during 2014 being unrecognised due to nocturnal episodes. There is also a strong possibility that my gradual increases in food sensitivities during this period leading to Irrritable Bowel Syndrome was linked to Cialis. This drug should be withdrawn right away for this condition.

Cialis (tadalafil):My doctor suggested for me Cialis 5 mg daily to treat Prostate enlargement however from day 1 to day 5 I was suffering from back pain with chest burning like heart attack. so my doctor stopped it immediately. Now I am using it .25 mg half day before sex. it is very good for erection and also to relieve prostate bad feeling during ejaculation

Cialis (tadalafil):I'm in my late 60s and had been struggling to frequent urination at night, an urgent need here and there during the day, ED, and low libido. My urologist recommended Cialis but when he mentioned the price and the fact that it would not be covered by insurance, I almost decided against it. He was quite sure it would help, however. So I invested in the first month's supply --- and  noticed a difference in respect to urination and the rest almost immediately. Quite amazing. Like some other people, I've had a bit of heartburn but no other side effects. Well worth the investment!

Cialis (tadalafil):2nd day on 5mg started to work with rock hard erections however experianced headache, lower bowel preassure. 3rd day erections would wake me up & hurt! Leg/ankles aches   severe lower bowel preassure like you need to go #2 but can't! Enjoyed the initial rockhard erections but not at these side effects or $230 for months supply! I'm 50 & work out 3Xs a week. Not worth side effects!

Cialis (tadalafil):My urologist suggested that I try 5 mg. Cialis daily for BPH (enlarged prostate). He gave me a two week supply to see if I would incur any side effects. He did make it very clear that treatment for BPH requires about a month's regular use of the 5 mg. daily dose. From the first day onward, I experienced significant heartburn, which was easily remedied by taking a dose of Zantac with the Cialis and a Zantac, 12 hours later. On the 5th day of Cialis, I experienced excruciating muscle pain starting with my lower back, into the buttocks, and legs. At the ER I was informed that between 5-7% of Cialis users will experience this and to stop using Cialis immediately.

Cialis (tadalafil):I started taking Cialis 5mg for BPH about 18 months ago.  I had been taking all the other FDA approved drugs (alpha blockers) like Avodart and various others.  They did not help at all.  My Doctor suggested I try Cialis 5mg to help shrink my enlarged prostate.  Within a few weeks the number of night time urinations dropped by about 30%.  After a year, I was only getting up once a night.  By 18 months I was sleeping all night.  The daytime urination urges also dropped by the same amounts.  I had few, if any, bad side effects. It did produce very firm errections!  My doctor has stated that my prostate is in great condition and is normal in size. For the record, I am a fit 66 years old and now sleep all night!

Cialis (tadalafil):Now 61, for four years I have suffered a reduction of urinary flow and an increased urge to urinate due to BPH.  Frequently, this would result in near sleepless nights as I arose every hour to urinate.  Also, each urination would be accompanied by some pain or burning.  Doctor encourages homeopathic remedies and for a few months, I got some relief from taking SAW PALMETTO.  However, this effect was short lived and soon all my symptoms returned.  Doctor next recommended Flomax (tamsulosin).  This failed due to two side effects; headache and loss of erections.  We finally tried a 5mg dose of daily Cialis.  What a difference!  My urinary problems have nearly vanished while experiencing only minor acceptable side effects.
